Name: Pod
Description: A single unit of shared resources within a cluster, comprised of one or more containers(Citation: Kube Kubectl)(Citation: Kube Pod)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new pod (ex: kubectl apply|run)

Name: Pod
Description: A single unit of shared resources within a cluster, comprised of one or more containers(Citation: Kube Kubectl)(Citation: Kube Pod)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a pod, including its settings and/or control data (ex: kubectl set|patch|edit)

Name: Pod
Description: A single unit of shared resources within a cluster, comprised of one or more containers(Citation: Kube Kubectl)(Citation: Kube Pod)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a pod and activity around it such as name, ID, namespace, or status

Name: Pod
Description: A single unit of shared resources within a cluster, comprised of one or more containers(Citation: Kube Kubectl)(Citation: Kube Pod)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of pods within a cluster (ex: kubectl get pods)

Name: Container
Description: A standard unit of virtualized software that packages up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another(Citation: Docker Docs Container)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new container (ex: docker create <container_name>)

Name: Container
Description: A standard unit of virtualized software that packages up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another(Citation: Docker Docs Container)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a container and activity around it such as name, ID, image, or status

Name: Container
Description: A standard unit of virtualized software that packages up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another(Citation: Docker Docs Container)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of containers (ex: docker ps)

Name: Container
Description: A standard unit of virtualized software that packages up code and all its dependencies so the application runs quickly and reliably from one computing environment to another(Citation: Docker Docs Container)
Data_Component_Description: Activation or invocation of a container (ex: docker start or docker restart)

Name: User Account
Description: A profile representing a user, device, service, or application used to authenticate and access resources
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about an account, which may include a username, user ID, environmental data, etc.

Name: User Account
Description: A profile representing a user, device, service, or application used to authenticate and access resources
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new account (ex: Windows EID 4720 or /etc/passwd logs)

Name: User Account
Description: A profile representing a user, device, service, or application used to authenticate and access resources
Data_Component_Description: Removal of an account (ex: Windows EID 4726 or /var/log access/authentication logs)

Name: User Account
Description: A profile representing a user, device, service, or application used to authenticate and access resources
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to an account, such as permissions and/or membership in specific groups (ex: Windows EID 4738 or /var/log access/authentication logs)

Name: User Account
Description: A profile representing a user, device, service, or application used to authenticate and access resources
Data_Component_Description: An attempt by a user to gain access to a network or computing resource, often by providing credentials (ex: Windows EID 4625 or /var/log/auth.log)

Name: Windows Registry
Data_Source: Windows Registry: Windows Registry Key Creation
Description: A Windows OS hierarchical database that stores much of the information and settings for software programs, hardware devices, user preferences, and operating-system configurations(Citation: Microsoft Registry)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new Registry Key (ex: Windows EID 4656 or Sysmon EID 12)

Name: Windows Registry
Data_Source: Windows Registry: Windows Registry Key Deletion
Description: A Windows OS hierarchical database that stores much of the information and settings for software programs, hardware devices, user preferences, and operating-system configurations(Citation: Microsoft Registry)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of a Registry Key (ex: Windows EID 4658 or Sysmon EID 12)

Name: Windows Registry
Data_Source: Windows Registry: Windows Registry Key Modification
Description: A Windows OS hierarchical database that stores much of the information and settings for software programs, hardware devices, user preferences, and operating-system configurations(Citation: Microsoft Registry)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a Registry Key and/or Key value (ex: Windows EID 4657 or Sysmon EID 13|14)

Name: Windows Registry
Data_Source: Windows Registry: Windows Registry Key Access
Description: A Windows OS hierarchical database that stores much of the information and settings for software programs, hardware devices, user preferences, and operating-system configurations(Citation: Microsoft Registry)
Data_Component_Description: Opening a Registry Key, typically to read the associated value (ex: Windows EID 4656)

Name: Script
Description: A file or stream containing a list of commands, allowing them to be launched in sequence(Citation: Microsoft PowerShell Logging)(Citation: FireEye PowerShell Logging)(Citation: Microsoft AMSI)
Data_Component_Description: Launching a list of commands through a script file (ex: Windows EID 4104)

Name: Image
Description: A single file used to deploy a virtual machine/bootable disk into an on-premise or third-party cloud environment(Citation: Microsoft Image)(Citation: Amazon AMI)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a virtual machine image (ex: Azure Compute Service Images PUT)

Name: Image
Description: A single file used to deploy a virtual machine/bootable disk into an on-premise or third-party cloud environment(Citation: Microsoft Image)(Citation: Amazon AMI)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a virtual machine image, including setting and/or control data (ex: Azure Compute Service Images PATCH)

Name: Image
Description: A single file used to deploy a virtual machine/bootable disk into an on-premise or third-party cloud environment(Citation: Microsoft Image)(Citation: Amazon AMI)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of a virtual machine image (ex: Azure Compute Service Images DELETE)

Name: Image
Description: A single file used to deploy a virtual machine/bootable disk into an on-premise or third-party cloud environment(Citation: Microsoft Image)(Citation: Amazon AMI)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a virtual machine image such as name, resource group, state, or type

Name: Web Credential
Description: Credential material, such as session cookies or tokens, used to authenticate to web applications and services(Citation: Medium Authentication Tokens)(Citation: Auth0 Access Tokens)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of new web credential material (ex: Windows EID 1200 or 4769)

Name: Web Credential
Description: Credential material, such as session cookies or tokens, used to authenticate to web applications and services(Citation: Medium Authentication Tokens)(Citation: Auth0 Access Tokens)
Data_Component_Description: An attempt by a user to gain access to a network or computing resource by providing web credentials (ex: Windows EID 1202)

Name: Named Pipe
Description: Mechanisms that allow inter-process communication locally or over the network. A named pipe is usually found as a file and processes attach to it(Citation: Microsoft Named Pipes)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a named pipe on a system, including pipe name and creating process (ex: Sysmon EIDs 17-18)

Name: Certificate
Description: A digital document, which highlights information such as the owner's identity, used to instill trust in public keys used while encrypting network communications
Data_Component_Description: Queried or logged information highlighting current and expired digital certificates (ex: Certificate transparency)

Name: WMI
Description: The infrastructure for management data and operations that enables local and remote management of Windows personal computers and servers(Citation: Microsoft WMI System Classes)(Citation: Microsoft WMI Architecture)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a WMI object, such as a filter, consumer, subscription, binding, or provider (ex: Sysmon EIDs 19-21)

Name: Cloud Storage
Description: Data object storage infrastructure hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of new cloud storage infrastructure (ex: AWS S3 CreateBucket)

Name: Cloud Storage
Description: Data object storage infrastructure hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to cloud storage infrastructure, including its settings and/or data (ex: AWS S3 PutObject or PutObjectAcl)

Name: Cloud Storage
Description: Data object storage infrastructure hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of cloud storage infrastructure (ex: AWS S3 DeleteBucket)

Name: Cloud Storage
Description: Data object storage infrastructure hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about cloud storage infrastructure and activity around it such as name, size, or owner

Name: Cloud Storage
Description: Data object storage infrastructure hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of cloud storage infrastructure (ex: AWS S3 ListBuckets or ListObjects)

Name: Cloud Storage
Description: Data object storage infrastructure hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Opening of a cloud storage infrastructure, typically to collect/read its value (ex: AWS S3 GetObject)

Name: Internet Scan
Description: Information obtained (commonly via active network traffic probes or web crawling) regarding various types of resources and servers connected to the public Internet
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about an Internet-facing resource gathered from a scan, such as running services or ports

Name: Internet Scan
Description: Information obtained (commonly via active network traffic probes or web crawling) regarding various types of resources and servers connected to the public Internet
Data_Component_Description: Logged network traffic in response to a scan showing both protocol header and body values

Name: Persona
Description: A malicious online profile representing a user commonly used by adversaries to social engineer or otherwise target victims
Data_Component_Description: Established, compromised, or otherwise acquired social media personas

Name: Group
Description: A collection of multiple user accounts that share the same access rights to the computer and/or network resources and have common security rights(Citation: Amazon IAM Groups)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a group which describes group and activity around it, such as name, permissions, or user accounts within the group

Name: Group
Description: A collection of multiple user accounts that share the same access rights to the computer and/or network resources and have common security rights(Citation: Amazon IAM Groups)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of available groups and/or their associated settings (ex: AWS list-groups)

Name: Group
Description: A collection of multiple user accounts that share the same access rights to the computer and/or network resources and have common security rights(Citation: Amazon IAM Groups)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a group, such as membership, name, or permissions (ex: Windows EID 4728 or 4732, AWS IAM UpdateGroup)

Name: Application Log
Description: Events collected by third-party services such as mail servers, web applications, or other appliances (not by the native OS or platform)(Citation: Confluence Logs)
Data_Component_Description: Logging, messaging, and other artifacts provided by third-party services (ex: metrics, errors, and/or alerts from mail/web applications)

Name: Logon Session
Description: Logon occurring on a system or resource (local, domain, or cloud) to which a user/device is gaining access after successful authentication and authorizaton(Citation: Microsoft Audit Logon Events)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a logon session, such as username, logon type, access tokens (security context, user SIDs, logon identifiers, and logon SID), and any activity associated within it

Name: Logon Session
Description: Logon occurring on a system or resource (local, domain, or cloud) to which a user/device is gaining access after successful authentication and authorizaton(Citation: Microsoft Audit Logon Events)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new user logon session (ex: Windows EID 4624, /var/log/utmp, or /var/log/wmtp)

Name: Instance
Description: A virtual server environment which runs workloads, hosted on-premise or by third-party cloud providers(Citation: Amazon VM)(Citation: Google VM)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new instance (ex: instance.insert within GCP Audit Logs)

Name: Instance
Description: A virtual server environment which runs workloads, hosted on-premise or by third-party cloud providers(Citation: Amazon VM)(Citation: Google VM)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to an instance, including its settings and/or control data (ex: instance.addResourcePolicies or instances.setMetadata within GCP Audit Logs)

Name: Instance
Description: A virtual server environment which runs workloads, hosted on-premise or by third-party cloud providers(Citation: Amazon VM)(Citation: Google VM)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of an instance (ex: instance.delete within GCP Audit Logs)

Name: Instance
Description: A virtual server environment which runs workloads, hosted on-premise or by third-party cloud providers(Citation: Amazon VM)(Citation: Google VM)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about an instance and activity around it such as name, type, or status

Name: Instance
Description: A virtual server environment which runs workloads, hosted on-premise or by third-party cloud providers(Citation: Amazon VM)(Citation: Google VM)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of instances within a cloud environment (ex: instance.list within GCP Audit Logs)

Name: Instance
Description: A virtual server environment which runs workloads, hosted on-premise or by third-party cloud providers(Citation: Amazon VM)(Citation: Google VM)
Data_Component_Description: Activation or invocation of an instance (ex: instance.start within GCP Audit Logs)

Name: Instance
Description: A virtual server environment which runs workloads, hosted on-premise or by third-party cloud providers(Citation: Amazon VM)(Citation: Google VM)
Data_Component_Description: Deactivation or stoppage of an instance (ex: instance.stop within GCP Audit Logs)

Name: Sensor Health
Description: Information from host telemetry providing insights about system status, errors, or other notable functional activity
Data_Component_Description: Logging, messaging, and other artifacts highlighting the health of host sensors (ex: metrics, errors, and/or exceptions from logging applications)

Name: File
Description: A computer resource object, managed by the I/O system, for storing data (such as images, text, videos, computer programs, or any wide variety of other media)(Citation: Microsoft File Mgmt)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a file, which may include information such as name, the content (ex: signature, headers, or data/media), user/ower, permissions, etc.

Name: File
Description: A computer resource object, managed by the I/O system, for storing data (such as images, text, videos, computer programs, or any wide variety of other media)(Citation: Microsoft File Mgmt)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new file (ex: Sysmon EID 11)

Name: File
Description: A computer resource object, managed by the I/O system, for storing data (such as images, text, videos, computer programs, or any wide variety of other media)(Citation: Microsoft File Mgmt)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of a file (ex: Sysmon EID 23)

Name: File
Description: A computer resource object, managed by the I/O system, for storing data (such as images, text, videos, computer programs, or any wide variety of other media)(Citation: Microsoft File Mgmt)
Data_Component_Description: Opening a file, which makes the file contents available to the requestor (ex: Windows EID 4663)

Name: File
Description: A computer resource object, managed by the I/O system, for storing data (such as images, text, videos, computer programs, or any wide variety of other media)(Citation: Microsoft File Mgmt)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a file, or its access permissions and attributes, typically to alter the contents of the targeted file (ex: Windows EID 4670 or Sysmon EID 2)

Name: Drive
Description: A non-volatile data storage device (hard drive, floppy disk, USB flash drive) with at least one formatted partition, typically mounted to the file system and/or assigned a drive letter(Citation: Sysmon EID 9)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a drive letter or mount point to a data storage device

Name: Drive
Description: A non-volatile data storage device (hard drive, floppy disk, USB flash drive) with at least one formatted partition, typically mounted to the file system and/or assigned a drive letter(Citation: Sysmon EID 9)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a drive letter or mount point of a data storage device

Name: Drive
Description: A non-volatile data storage device (hard drive, floppy disk, USB flash drive) with at least one formatted partition, typically mounted to the file system and/or assigned a drive letter(Citation: Sysmon EID 9)
Data_Component_Description: Opening of a data storage device with an assigned drive letter or mount point

Name: Snapshot
Description: A point-in-time copy of cloud volumes (files, settings, etc.) that can be created and/or deployed in cloud environments(Citation: Microsoft Snapshot)(Citation: Amazon Snapshots)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new snapshot (ex: AWS create-snapshot)

Name: Snapshot
Description: A point-in-time copy of cloud volumes (files, settings, etc.) that can be created and/or deployed in cloud environments(Citation: Microsoft Snapshot)(Citation: Amazon Snapshots)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a snapshop, such as metadata and control data (ex: AWS modify-snapshot-attribute)

Name: Snapshot
Description: A point-in-time copy of cloud volumes (files, settings, etc.) that can be created and/or deployed in cloud environments(Citation: Microsoft Snapshot)(Citation: Amazon Snapshots)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of a snapshot (ex: AWS delete-snapshot)

Name: Snapshot
Description: A point-in-time copy of cloud volumes (files, settings, etc.) that can be created and/or deployed in cloud environments(Citation: Microsoft Snapshot)(Citation: Amazon Snapshots)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a snapshot, which may include information such as ID, type, and status

Name: Snapshot
Description: A point-in-time copy of cloud volumes (files, settings, etc.) that can be created and/or deployed in cloud environments(Citation: Microsoft Snapshot)(Citation: Amazon Snapshots)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of snapshops within a cloud environment (ex: AWS describe-snapshots)

Name: Command
Description: A directive given to a computer program, acting as an interpreter of some kind, in order to perform a specific task(Citation: Confluence Linux Command  Line)(Citation: Audit OSX)
Data_Component_Description: Invoking a computer program directive to perform a specific task (ex: Windows EID 4688 of cmd.exe showing command-line parameters, ~/.bash_history, or ~/.zsh_history)

Name: Kernel
Description: A computer program, at the core of a computer OS, that resides in memory and facilitates interactions between hardware and software components(Citation: STIG Audit Kernel Modules)(Citation: Init Man Page)
Data_Component_Description: An object file that contains code to extend the running kernel of an OS, typically used to add support for new hardware (as device drivers) and/or filesystems, or for adding system calls

Name: Driver
Description: A computer program that operates or controls a particular type of device that is attached to a computer. Provides a software interface to hardware devices, enabling operating systems and other computer programs to access hardware functions without needing to know precise details about the hardware being used(Citation: IOKit Fundamentals)(Citation: Windows Getting Started Drivers)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a driver and activity around it such as driver issues reporting or integrity (page hash, code) checking

Name: Driver
Description: A computer program that operates or controls a particular type of device that is attached to a computer. Provides a software interface to hardware devices, enabling operating systems and other computer programs to access hardware functions without needing to know precise details about the hardware being used(Citation: IOKit Fundamentals)(Citation: Windows Getting Started Drivers)
Data_Component_Description: Attaching a driver to either user or kernel-mode of a system (ex: Sysmon EID 6)

Name: Volume
Description: Block object storage hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, typically made available to resources as virtualized hard drives(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a cloud volume (ex: AWS create-volume)

Name: Volume
Description: Block object storage hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, typically made available to resources as virtualized hard drives(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a cloud volume, including its settings and control data (ex: AWS modify-volume)

Name: Volume
Description: Block object storage hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, typically made available to resources as virtualized hard drives(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of a a cloud volume (ex: AWS delete-volume)

Name: Volume
Description: Block object storage hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, typically made available to resources as virtualized hard drives(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a cloud volume and activity around it, such as id, type, state, and size

Name: Volume
Description: Block object storage hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, typically made available to resources as virtualized hard drives(Citation: Amazon S3)(Citation: Azure Blob Storage)(Citation: Google Cloud Storage)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of available volumes within a cloud environment (ex: AWS describe-volumes)

Name: Cloud Service
Description: Infrastructure, platforms, or software that are hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon AWS)(Citation: Azure Products)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a cloud service and activity around it such as name, type, or purpose/function

Name: Cloud Service
Description: Infrastructure, platforms, or software that are hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon AWS)(Citation: Azure Products)
Data_Component_Description: Deactivation or stoppage of a cloud service (ex: AWS Cloudtrail StopLogging)

Name: Cloud Service
Description: Infrastructure, platforms, or software that are hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon AWS)(Citation: Azure Products)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of cloud services (ex: AWS ECS ListServices)

Name: Cloud Service
Description: Infrastructure, platforms, or software that are hosted on-premise or by third-party providers, made available to users through network connections and/or APIs(Citation: Amazon AWS)(Citation: Azure Products)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a cloud service, including its settings and/or data (ex: AWS CloudTrail DeleteTrail or DeleteConfigRule)

Name: Malware Repository
Description: Information obtained (via shared or submitted samples) regarding malicious software (droppers, backdoors, etc.) used by adversaries
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a malicious payload, such as compilation times, file hashes, as well as watermarks or other identifiable configuration information

Name: Malware Repository
Description: Information obtained (via shared or submitted samples) regarding malicious software (droppers, backdoors, etc.) used by adversaries
Data_Component_Description: Code, strings, and other signatures that compromise a malicious payload

Name: Network Share
Description: A storage resource (typically a folder or drive) made available from one host to others using network protocols, such as Server Message Block (SMB) or Network File System (NFS)(Citation: Microsoft NFS Overview)
Data_Component_Description: Opening a network share, which makes the contents available to the requestor (ex: Windows EID 5140 or 5145)

Name: Network Traffic
Description: Data transmitted across a network (ex: Web, DNS, Mail, File, etc.), that is either summarized (ex: Netflow) and/or captured as raw data in an analyzable format (ex: PCAP)
Data_Component_Description: Summarized network packet data, with metrics, such as protocol headers and volume (ex: Netflow or Zeek http.log)

Name: Network Traffic
Description: Data transmitted across a network (ex: Web, DNS, Mail, File, etc.), that is either summarized (ex: Netflow) and/or captured as raw data in an analyzable format (ex: PCAP)
Data_Component_Description: Logged network traffic data showing both protocol header and body values (ex: PCAP)

Name: Network Traffic
Description: Data transmitted across a network (ex: Web, DNS, Mail, File, etc.), that is either summarized (ex: Netflow) and/or captured as raw data in an analyzable format (ex: PCAP)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a network connection, such as capturing socket information with a source/destination IP and port(s) (ex: Windows EID 5156, Sysmon EID 3, or Zeek conn.log)

Name: Cluster
Description: A set of containerized computing resources that are managed together but have separate nodes to execute various tasks and/or applications(Citation: Kube Cluster Admin)(Citation: Kube Cluster Info)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a cluster and activity around it such as name, namespace, age, or status

Name: Scheduled Job
Description: Automated tasks that can be executed at a specific time or on a recurring schedule running in the background (ex: Cron daemon, task scheduler, BITS)(Citation: Microsoft Tasks)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a scheduled job, which may include information such as name, timing, command(s), etc.

Name: Scheduled Job
Description: Automated tasks that can be executed at a specific time or on a recurring schedule running in the background (ex: Cron daemon, task scheduler, BITS)(Citation: Microsoft Tasks)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new scheduled job (ex: Windows EID 4698 or /var/log cron logs)

Name: Scheduled Job
Description: Automated tasks that can be executed at a specific time or on a recurring schedule running in the background (ex: Cron daemon, task scheduler, BITS)(Citation: Microsoft Tasks)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a scheduled job, such as modifications to the execution launch (ex: Windows EID 4702 or /var/log cron logs)

Name: Firmware
Description: Computer software that provides low-level control for the hardware and device(s) of a host, such as BIOS or UEFI/EFI
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to firmware, including its settings and/or data, such as MBR (Master Boot Record) and VBR (Volume Boot Record)

Name: Active Directory
Data_Source: Active Directory: Active Directory Object Creation
Description: A database and set of services that allows administrators to manage permissions, access to network resources, and stored data objects (user, group, application, or devices)(Citation: Microsoft AD DS Getting Started)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new active directory object (ex: Windows EID 5137)

Name: Active Directory
Data_Source: Active Directory: Active Directory Object Deletion
Description: A database and set of services that allows administrators to manage permissions, access to network resources, and stored data objects (user, group, application, or devices)(Citation: Microsoft AD DS Getting Started)
Data_Component_Description: Removal of an active directory object (ex: Windows EID 5141)

Name: Active Directory
Data_Source: Active Directory: Active Directory Object Modification
Description: A database and set of services that allows administrators to manage permissions, access to network resources, and stored data objects (user, group, application, or devices)(Citation: Microsoft AD DS Getting Started)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to an active directory object (ex: Windows EID 5163 or 5136)

Name: Active Directory
Data_Source: Active Directory: Active Directory Credential Request
Description: A database and set of services that allows administrators to manage permissions, access to network resources, and stored data objects (user, group, application, or devices)(Citation: Microsoft AD DS Getting Started)
Data_Component_Description: A user requested active directory credentials, such as a ticket or token (ex: Windows EID 4769)

Name: Active Directory
Data_Source: Active Directory: Active Directory Object Access
Description: A database and set of services that allows administrators to manage permissions, access to network resources, and stored data objects (user, group, application, or devices)(Citation: Microsoft AD DS Getting Started)
Data_Component_Description: Opening of an active directory object, typically to collect/read its value (ex: Windows EID 4661)

Name: Service
Description: A computer process that is configured to execute continuously in the background and perform system tasks, in some cases before any user has logged in(Citation: Microsoft Services)(Citation: Linux Services Run Levels)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a service/daemon, which may include information such as name, service executable, start type, etc.

Name: Service
Description: A computer process that is configured to execute continuously in the background and perform system tasks, in some cases before any user has logged in(Citation: Microsoft Services)(Citation: Linux Services Run Levels)
Data_Component_Description: Initial construction of a new service/daemon (ex: Windows EID 4697 or /var/log daemon logs)

Name: Service
Description: A computer process that is configured to execute continuously in the background and perform system tasks, in some cases before any user has logged in(Citation: Microsoft Services)(Citation: Linux Services Run Levels)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a service/daemon, such as changes to name, description, and/or start type (ex: Windows EID 7040 or /var/log daemon logs)

Name: Domain Name
Description: Information obtained (commonly through registration or activity logs) regarding one or more IP addresses registered with human readable names (ex: mitre.org)
Data_Component_Description: Logged domain name system (DNS) data highlighting timelines of domain to IP address resolutions (ex: passive DNS)

Name: Domain Name
Description: Information obtained (commonly through registration or activity logs) regarding one or more IP addresses registered with human readable names (ex: mitre.org)
Data_Component_Description: Queried domain name system (DNS) registry data highlighting current domain to IP address resolutions (ex: dig/nslookup queries)

Name: Domain Name
Description: Information obtained (commonly through registration or activity logs) regarding one or more IP addresses registered with human readable names (ex: mitre.org)
Data_Component_Description: Information about domain name assignments and other domain metadata (ex: WHOIS)

Name: Process
Description: Instances of computer programs that are being executed by at least one thread. Processes have memory space for process executables, loaded modules (DLLs or shared libraries), and allocated memory regions containing everything from user input to application-specific data structures(Citation: Microsoft Processes and Threads)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a running process, which may include information such as environment variables, image name, user/owner, etc.

Name: Process
Description: Instances of computer programs that are being executed by at least one thread. Processes have memory space for process executables, loaded modules (DLLs or shared libraries), and allocated memory regions containing everything from user input to application-specific data structures(Citation: Microsoft Processes and Threads)
Data_Component_Description: Birth of a new running process (ex: Sysmon EID 1 or Windows EID 4688)

Name: Process
Description: Instances of computer programs that are being executed by at least one thread. Processes have memory space for process executables, loaded modules (DLLs or shared libraries), and allocated memory regions containing everything from user input to application-specific data structures(Citation: Microsoft Processes and Threads)
Data_Component_Description: Exit of a running process (ex: Sysmon EID 5 or Windows EID 4689)

Name: Process
Description: Instances of computer programs that are being executed by at least one thread. Processes have memory space for process executables, loaded modules (DLLs or shared libraries), and allocated memory regions containing everything from user input to application-specific data structures(Citation: Microsoft Processes and Threads)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a process, or its contents, typically to write and/or execute code in the memory of the target process (ex: Sysmon EID 8)

Name: Process
Description: Instances of computer programs that are being executed by at least one thread. Processes have memory space for process executables, loaded modules (DLLs or shared libraries), and allocated memory regions containing everything from user input to application-specific data structures(Citation: Microsoft Processes and Threads)
Data_Component_Description: Opening of a process by another process, typically to read memory of the target process (ex: Sysmon EID 10)

Name: Process
Description: Instances of computer programs that are being executed by at least one thread. Processes have memory space for process executables, loaded modules (DLLs or shared libraries), and allocated memory regions containing everything from user input to application-specific data structures(Citation: Microsoft Processes and Threads)
Data_Component_Description: Operating system function/method calls executed by a process

Name: Firewall
Description: A network security system, running locally on an endpoint or remotely as a service (ex: cloud environment), that monitors and controls incoming/outgoing network traffic based on predefined rules(Citation: AWS Sec Groups VPC)
Data_Component_Description: Contextual data about a firewall and activity around it such as name, policy, or status

Name: Firewall
Description: A network security system, running locally on an endpoint or remotely as a service (ex: cloud environment), that monitors and controls incoming/outgoing network traffic based on predefined rules(Citation: AWS Sec Groups VPC)
Data_Component_Description: Deactivation or stoppage of a cloud service (ex: Write/Delete entries within Azure Firewall Activity Logs)

Name: Firewall
Description: A network security system, running locally on an endpoint or remotely as a service (ex: cloud environment), that monitors and controls incoming/outgoing network traffic based on predefined rules(Citation: AWS Sec Groups VPC)
Data_Component_Description: Changes made to a firewall rule, typically to allow/block specific network traffic (ex: Windows EID 4950 or Write/Delete entries within Azure Firewall Rule Collection Activity Logs)

Name: Firewall
Description: A network security system, running locally on an endpoint or remotely as a service (ex: cloud environment), that monitors and controls incoming/outgoing network traffic based on predefined rules(Citation: AWS Sec Groups VPC)
Data_Component_Description: An extracted list of available firewalls and/or their associated settings/rules (ex: Azure Network Firewall CLI Show commands)

Name: Module
Description: Executable files consisting of one or more shared classes and interfaces, such as portable executable (PE) format binaries/dynamic link libraries (DLL), executable and linkable format (ELF) binaries/shared libraries, and Mach-O format binaries/shared libraries(Citation: Microsoft LoadLibrary)(Citation: Microsoft Module Class)
Data_Component_Description: Attaching a module into the memory of a process/program, typically to access shared resources/features provided by the module (ex: Sysmon EID 7)
